text: If the queue is.. they're allowed to just move onto the next person. Their goal at office hours is to help you get unstuck, it's not to solve the MP for you, its not to debug your code.
its not to answer your question as to whether your function is right or not.

that's not what they're there for, the office hours are there for helping you get unstuck, so that means you've already gotten stuck, that you've tried everything at your disposal to try and get unstuck, you debugged, you open valgrind, you've run it with asan, you've run it in gdb, you've printed stuff, you know where the error is occurring, you know the symptom, you dont know why, but you know where and can explain to a TA, exactly whats going wrong.
A bad question is, "ive got a seg fault." Then the TA says, "do you know what line?" and you reply, "no."
that means you haven't done your work, so please, before you add yourself to the queue, make sure you have well formed, specific, question in mind and you've done your homework.

Furthermore, the queue is not for you to sign up early, you are to put your name on the queue when you are present in the lab, in the office hour for which you are attending. You are not to put your name on there at 6 am, anticipating that you will have a question at 10.
the ta's will delete you from the queue if you do this

if youre going to office hours, go to the lab machine, log in, get your code up, get whatever diagrams you need to explain to the ta, open on the desk in front of you, and only then, add your name to the queue
So, im just doing these things to try and ensure that we can atleast have a better shot of getting to the bottom of these queues that get up to 30 or 40 people
because there is only so many staff to go around, i only have so many dollars to pay those staff so im doing what i ca
[question is asked]
[no audio]
Come talk to me, come talk to me privatly
ok, lets jump in,
So were talking about trees, so lets continue thinking about trees
here's a picture of a binary tree, heres a (on the right) a declaration of the binary tree class and we've got the binary tree .tcc below

were going to write a function called traverse, which takes a const node star and a functor, and runs that functor on every element of that tree. so for example that functor maybe really really simple, it just prints out the data. it might be something that, you know, has some other functionality, it might do something with the data, beyond just printing it. all you have to think about is that there is some operation that i would like to do on everything on this tree

so how do i get that function to be called on every single data element in this tree . note that the functor isn't going to be called on the nodes, why not? well nobody knows about nodes except for us. so the only thing that this functors going to be invoked on are  the data elements inside the nodes. remember the node class is private
saying to someone, you'll take a node for their functor, they cant even say that type, so that doesn't make any sense
this functor is going to be applied to the data elements that are inside of this tree
so for example, i might apply the functor to the value a, but not the node that contains a
and thats a subtle but important distinction
were going to write this function, lets write a delcaration first
declarations are always going to go in your header file
where, am i going to put this traverse fucntion and why?
am i going to put it in the public or the private section
So here's the signature, i return void. where's it going to go, public or private/?
private? why private?
it takes nodes right, no one else can tell know about nodes except the private internals of the binary tree class
this cannot be public so this is going to be a private function, so were going to put it in the private section
we're also taking a functor, a generic functor that is not something that's part of a class heirarchy, just some object that happens to override operator parenthesis
so this fucntion is itself be a template function, inside of the template class
so this is going to be a template function, fun, whatever that function happens to be, when i invoke this function
so even inside this header file, im going to declare this function as a template
so were goign to have somethign like..
[writing function headers on screen]
[no audio]
i am ommiting the parameter names here, in the header file
for space
i could name them, you cannot omit the name of the parameter in the definition of the function, you have no way of refering to the parameter if you do so
a large number of people just took size_t in their constructor for the quilt, and then used size_t as the variable name, size_t is a type, you have to have a varaible of that type
so im allowed to omit the name of the parameter in the declaration of the function, because im not using it yet, but in the definition i am required to give it a name in order to even refer to it
thats the difference
i can omit the name in the header file, but not in the cpp file. i have to have a name to refer to the variable at that point, here where im declaring the function signature, it just wants the types
